reason.raw: Actually I'm going to decline this for now and talk with @caguero about the order in which we should do things.
reason.html: Actually I'm going to decline this for now and talk with @caguero about the order in which we should do things.

description.raw:
* Added step back icon and substituted existing ones with lighter versions from @spaepcke 

* Step back and multistep functionality

* Changed logic in physics/World to support log files with skipped samples. For example, The current sample is iteration 10 and the next one is 12, so stepping forward first goes to 11 and doesn't update the scene yet, then the next step goes to 12.

* There's something weird with the way logs are recorded. The very first chunk is the complete state of the world and has no record of iterations, then from the next chunk onwards there are iterations. The thing is that while playing back, you can see that from this "chunk 0" to "chunk 1", there's a big jump in the model's motions. I wasn't sure what to do about it, whether this extra first sample is needed or not, so I left it there. Thus if you start playback paused and step once forward, the models will move but the iterations/time will remain the same.

![logplaywidget3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2911854014-logplaywidget3.png)

  • There's something weird with the way logs are recorded. The very first chunk is the complete state of the world and has no record of iterations, then from the next chunk onwards there are iterations. The thing is that while playing back, you can see that from this "chunk 0" to "chunk 1", there's a big jump in the model's motions. I wasn't sure what to do about it, whether this extra first sample is needed or not, so I left it there. Thus if you start playback paused and step once forward, the models will move but the iterations/time will remain the same.
